articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Megan Cassidy, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: $7 million settlement approved in Arpaio-era jail death
articles.description: Ernest "Marty" Atencio died in a Maricopa County jail in 2011.

articles.title: Jodi Arias sang a Christmas carol in jail, won turkey dinner
articles.description: In December 2010, then-Maricopa County Sheriff Joe Arpaio hosted a reality-show-type singing contest in his jails. Jodi Arias participated and won. Her reward was a turkey dinner. Video by the Maricopa County Sheriff's Office.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Maricopa County's Tent City jail officially shut down
articles.description: Tent City, Maricopa County's infamous outdoor jail, was closed with the remaining inmates were transported Saturday night to Durango Jail.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Judge: No reduced bond for man charged with Christine Mustafa's murder
articles.description: A Maricopa County Superior Court judge denied a motion Monday that would have made it easier for Robert John Interval Jr. to be released from jail.

articles.author: The Arizona Republic, The Arizona Republic
articles.title: Tent City, home of inmates in pink underwear, officially shuts down
articles.description: The brainchild of former sheriff Joe Arpaio, inmates at the Maricopa County outdoor jail infamously wore pink underwear.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Maricopa County jail inmate attempts suicide by hanging
articles.description: The inmate was hospitalized with life-threatening injuries after attempting to hang herself.

articles.title: Woman accused of stalking, threatening Paradise Valley man
articles.description: Police booked Jacqueline Ades at a Maricopa County Sheriff's Office jail after numerous reports of her stalking a man she met online.

articles.title: After recent $7 million settlement, a look at 5 other payouts from Arpaio-era jail deaths
articles.description: A recent $7 million payout by Maricopa County for a death at one of its jail isn't the only seven-figure payout they've made for an inmate death.

articles.title: Man arrested in tow-truck driver's shooting death at Phoenix apartment
articles.description: Billy Wayne West Jr. is being held in a Maricopa County jail on suspicion of first-degree murder in the death of tow-truck driver Alfredo Palencia.

articles.description: Tiffany Sunshine Avalos and Ray Rudy Saucedo were being held in a Maricopa County jail on Monday morning with their bond at $250,000 each.

articles.title: Sheriff's Office: Inmates attack 3 detention officers at Phoenix jail
articles.description: Maricopa County Sheriff Paul Penzone calls for strict sentencing for inmates who attacked three detention officers over the course of two days.

articles.title: Sheriff: Orange is the new black — and white — at county jails
articles.description: Switch from stripes is expected to save Maricopa County more than $20,000 annually, Sheriff Paul Penzone says.

articles.title: Phoenix awards $250,000 in Arpaio-era jail death
articles.description: The Phoenix City Council Wednesday voted to award $250,000 to the family of Ernest "Marty" Atencio, who died after a 2011 incident at a county jail.

articles.description: Gov. Doug Ducey's office said it won't proceed with plans to open an employment center because the Maricopa County Sheriff's Office isn't cooperating.

articles.title: Sheriff's video shows bloody use-of-force incident against inmate
articles.description: The Maricopa County Attorney's Office has declined to file charges against the detention employees involved, though two received internal discipline.

articles.title: 'Conditions have not changed': Activists call for policy reforms in Maricopa County jails
articles.description: Migrant-rights group Puente Arizona is asking Maricopa County Sheriff Paul Penzone to end what activists call an "Arpaio culture of hate."

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Some Maricopa County inmates going on hunger strike to protest poor food, activist says
articles.description: Inmates at several MCSO detention facilities are going on a three-day hunger strike to protest the quality and frequency of the food they are serving.

articles.title: MCSO: Nearly half of work-furloughed inmates failed drug test
articles.description: More than 40 percent of Maricopa County inmates in the work furlough program tested positive for drugs, officials said Tuesday.

articles.title: MCSO's K-9s look doggone sharp in donated protective vests

articles.title: Why downtown Phoenix's problem with transients defies easy answers
